title: Brockton man allegedly in US illegally sentenced to prison for raping 14-year-old girl
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime The man was found guilty of raping the 14-year-old victim on multiple occasions in 2020, according to prosecutors.
A Brockton man originally from Cape Verde was sentenced to seven years in state prison after pleading guilty to raping a 14-year-old girl in 2020, prosecutors said.
Erickson Barbosa, 32, was also sentenced to five years of probation after his release from prison, according to the Bristol County District Attorney’s office.

title: ‘Special stuff’: Why Patriots CB Marcus Jones’s October was one to remember
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots A new contract extension and an AFC Defensive Player of the Month award have given Jones reason to smile.
Marcus Jones Danielle Parhizkaran/The Boston Globe Zak Kuhr offered a succinct response when he was asked what he’s been seeing from Marcus Jones lately.
“A big smile on his face,” the Patriots’ interim defensive play-caller said.

title: Dartmouth man pleads guilty to 2024 murder of New Bedford woman
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Crime Tyler Baglini received a life sentence in prison with the possibility of parole in 25 years after he changed his plea to guilty, court records show.
In an appearance in Fall River Superior Court, Tyler Baglini pleaded guilty Tuesday to murdering Kerri Fidalgo, of New Bedford.
Lane Turner/The Boston Globe ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Boston police says they seized 9 more scooters as crackdown continues
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime Tuesday’s operation was the latest in an ongoing safety initiative that police are calling “Operation Safe Scooter.
” The Boston Police Department said it seized nine more scooters Tuesday night as part of "Operation Safe Scooter.

" Boston Police Department By Darin Zullo October 30, 2025 | 7:25 PM 3 minutes to read The Boston Police Department carried out its latest operation Tuesday night in a series of efforts to keep unsafe scooters and mopeds off the streets.

title: Bruins defenseman, Haverhill native undergoes ankle surgery
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins Jordan Harris is expected to be on the shelf for two months.
Jordan Harris is expected to miss two months with an ankle injury.

John Tlumacki/Boston Globe By Conor Ryan October 30, 2025 | 7:24 PM 1 minute to read The Bruins’ D corps took a hit earlier this week, as Boston announced Thursday night that defenseman Jordan Harris will be on the shelf for months.

title: Joe Mazzulla has expected response when asked about Celtics tanking this year
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Celtics “I would be very offended.
" Joe Mazzulla and the Celtics are 2-3 on the season.

Danielle Parhizkaran/The Boston Globe By Conor Ryan October 30, 2025 | 6:25 PM 2 minutes to read The Boston Celtics have bounced back after an 0-3 start to the 2025-26 season with two consecutive wins, including a blowout victory over one of the top contenders in the Eastern Conference in the Cavaliers on Wednesday night.

title: FBI arrests man accused of using explosives on Woburn ATM
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Local News Christopher Silva, 43, was arrested Wednesday morning at his Stoneham home by the FBI Boston’s Violent Crimes Task Force.

By Sana Muneer October 30, 2025 | 6:10 PM 1 minute to read A Stoneham man was arrested and federally charged Wednesday after allegedly placing an explosive device on an ATM in Woburn in early September, police said.
Christopher Silva, 43, was arrested Wednesday morning at his Stoneham home by the FBI Boston’s Violent Crimes Task Force.
